Text: If the president is serious about "defending freedom" and lowering gas prices, he should look at our industry right here at home.

The U.S. is more than capable of producing our own energy. There are plenty of oil and gas producers here in my state who would welcome the opportunity to get back to work and supply oil across the country. And I know we are not the only ones willing to do so.

He begged OPEC+ to increase production, he dipped into our emergency oil reserves, and now he's watching Putin weaponize the energy market. This is not defending freedom; this is the consequence of his inaction.

Our president handed our energy independence to our foreign adversaries on day one. Instead of bolstering American producers, he weakened the industry in favor of unsustainable renewables and gave up any leverage our country had against competitors like China and Russia.

President Biden is leading the American people to believe high energy costs are the price to pay for ‚Äúdefending freedom.‚Äù 

This could not be further from the truth.
The material for the Nord Stream 2 pipeline is already purchased because President Biden lifted sanctions the first time. What is going to stop Putin from using these?

President Biden again mentioned the pain Americans are feeling at the pump. If he really cares¬†to fix this, why are we not opening¬†up drilling¬†in the U.S.? Seems like the perfect time to get American¬†energy¬†producers back to work.

I am proud to co-sponsor H.R. 426, the Protection of Women and Girls in Sports Act, which safeguards female athletes. This bill makes clear that schools¬†who allow biological males to compete in women‚Äôs sports are in violation of Title IX.
It‚Äôs¬†beyond unfair¬†for the girls and women who train around the clock¬†to have their dreams¬†destroyed by factors that are out of their control.

While this executive order is a clear violation of Title IX, we have¬†also¬†seen the consequences of this decision¬†the¬†past year¬†with¬†the NCAA‚Äôs adoption of this order.

I have three daughters who all participate in sports. As their father, I want them to be able to compete on a level playing field with their peers. I watch their hard work and discipline go into training and see the pride they feel when¬†determination pays off.

Today is National Girls and Women in Sports Day.¬†After¬†President Biden signed¬†his¬†executive order calling on schools to allow biological¬†men¬†to participate in women‚Äôs sports,¬†it‚Äôs become that much more¬†important to shed light on this day.
